required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Robotic Mechanical Coring for the Treatment of Moderate to Severe Facial Wrinkles
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of the Safety and Efficacy of Aime Robotic Mechanical Coring Device for the Treatment of Moderate to Severe Facial Wrinkles

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a prospective, up to 4 center study of the safety and efficacy of mechanical coring with directional closure to achieve directional skin tightening intended to improve the appearance of wrinkles of the face in up to 45 subjects after one treatment on the cheeks.

detailed_description.textblock: Prospective, up to 4 center study of the safety and efficacy of mechanical coring with directional closure to achieve directional skin tightening intended to improve the appearance of wrinkles of the face. Up to 45 subjects who meet inclusion/exclusion criteria will be treated. All subjects will be monitored for a period 7, 30, and 90 days post treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess level of wrinkle improvement using the Lemperle Wrinkle Scale
primary_outcome.description: Change in wrinkles from baseline to 90 days post-treatment as assessed by independent physician graders from photographs using the Lemperle Wrinkle Scale (LWS). No wrinkles (Optimal Cosmetic Result) =0, Just perceptible wrinkle =1, Shallow wrinkles=2, Moderately deep wrinkle=3, Deep wrinkle, well-defined edges=4, Very deep wrinkle, redundant fold=5

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess aesthetic improvement using Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Overall aesthetic improvement as assessed using the Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) by the Principal Investigator at 90 days post-treatment compared to baseline. Very much improved (Optimal cosmetic result) = 5, Much Improved (Marked improvement from initial condition, but not completely optimal)=4, Improved (Obvious improvement in appearance from initial condition, but re-treatment is indicated)=3, No Change (The appearance is essentially the same as original condition)=2, Worse (The appearance is worse than the original condition)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess subject satisfaction post-treatment using Subject Satisfaction Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Subject satisfaction as assessed using the Subject Satisfaction Scale (SSS) completed by subjects at the Day 30 and 90 follow up visits. Satisfaction with the aesthetic appearance of the treatment area. Very Satisfied=4, Satisfied=3, Having No Opinion=2, Unsatisfied=1, Very Unsatisfied=0

other_outcome.measure: Assess subject's assessment of discomfort and pain using Visual Analogue Scale
other_outcome.description: Subject's assessment of discomfort and pain after treatments as measured by a VAS Pain Scale immediately after treatment.

other_outcome.measure: Assess safety profile by recording adverse events
other_outcome.description: Subjects experiencing a treatment-related adverse event (AE) in the first 90 days post-treatment.

arm_group.description: All subjects will receive one coring treatment on the cheeks with the robotic coring device.

intervention.description: Venus Aime is a micro-coring device of the skin that can potentially help reduce moderate to severe facial wrinkles.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Healthy, male or female subjects between 40 and 75 years of age.
2. Able to read, understand and voluntarily provide written Informed Consent.
3. Able and willing to comply with the treatment/follow-up schedule and requirements.
4. Women of childbearing age are required to be using a reliable method of birth control at least 3 months prior to study enrollment and for the duration of the study and have a negative Urine Pregnancy test at baseline.
5. Fitzpatrick skin type I to IV.
6. Cheek areas are at least a score of 3 using the Lemperle Wrinkle Scale as judged by the Investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Previous aesthetic (device and/or surgical) skin treatment (injection of dermal fillers, fat, or botulinum toxin), in the treated areas in the previous 6 months.
2. Fat, collagen, silicone, tattoos, body jewelry, that cannot be removed for the duration of treatment and any other synthetic material in the treatment area.
3. Scar(s) in the area to be treated.
4. Excessive sun exposure and use of tanning beds or tanning creams within 30 days to prior to treatment
5. History of keloid formation or hypertrophic scarring.
6. Active smoker or having quit smoking in the last 3 months.
7. Active, chronic, or recurrent infection
8. Compromised immune and/or healing system (e.g., poorly controlled diabetes,)
9. Hypersensitivity/allergy to analgesic agents, tumescent (Saline, Epinephrine, Lidocaine)
10. Co-morbid condition that could limit the ability to participate in the study or to comply with follow-up requirements.
11. Pregnant or breastfeeding
12. Any indication that may cause excessive bleeding, e.g., anticoagulants or bleeding disorder.
13. Carcinoma, melanoma, or any other cancerous condition in the last 6 months.
14. Currently or in the last 1-month part of another clinical study of an investigational drug and/or experimental medical device
15. Any issue that, at the discretion of the investigator would contra-indicate the subject's participation.
